item.title: A straightforward approach: Managing the ego
item.description: I like to think of myself as a creative problem-solver. Finding ingenious solutions to complex issues is something I take pride in. With enough time and focus, my logic and reasoning skills (and a healthy dose of sarcasm) can usually crack the code. However, today I encountered a real head-scratcher, a problem that genuinely stumped me (cue the sarcastic surprise). Here’s a breakdown of the situation: The client has been using project accounting since January 1, 2009, with no changes to their fiscal period setup.
